sourcesContent:
import React, {Component} from "react"; import './About.css'; import 'bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css'; import { ListGroup, ListGroupItem, ListGroupItemHeading, ListGroupItemText, Row, Col, Card, CardImg, CardText, CardBody, CardTitle, CardDeck, } from 'reactstrap'; import brianaImg from './briana.jpg'; import edwinImg from './edwin.jpeg'; import ryanImg from './ryan.jpg'; import ojasImg from './ojas.jpg'; import travisImg from './travis.jpeg'; export class About extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props); this.state = { people: [], }; } componentDidMount() { fetch('https://gitlab.com/api/v4/projects/14474532/repository/contributors') .then(res => res.json()) .then((data) => { console.log(data); this.setState({ people: data }); }) .catch(console.log) fetch('https://gitlab.com/api/v4/projects/14474532/issues') .then(res => res.json()) .then((info) => { console.log(info); this.setState({ issues: info }); }) } render() { var briana = {'commits':0, 'issues':0} var ojas = {'commits':0, 'issues':0} var travis = {'commits':0, 'issues':0} var edwin = {'commits':0, 'issues':0} var ryan = {'commits':0, 'issues':0} var totalCommits = 0 var totalIssues = 0 var person; for(person of this.state.people){ if(person.name == "Ojas Patel"){ ojas['commits'] += person.commits; } else if(person.name == "Travarin"){ travis['commits'] += person.commits; } else if(person.name == "Edwin_Silerio"){ edwin['commits'] += person.commits; } else if(person.name == "Ryan Morris"){ ryan['commits'] += person.commits; } else if(person.name == "brianawhite"){ briana['commits'] += person.commits; } } var issue; for(issue in this.state.issues){ if(this.state.issues[issue].closed_by != null){ if(this.state.issues[issue].closed_by.name == "Ojas Patel"){ ojas['issues'] += 1; } else if(this.state.issues[issue].closed_by.name == "Travis Langston"){ travis['issues'] += 1; } else if(this.state.issues[issue].closed_by.name == "Edwin Silerio"){ edwin['issues'] += 1; } else if(this.state.issues[issue].closed_by.name == "Ryan Morris"){ ryan['issues'] += 1; } else if(this.state.issues[issue].closed_by.name == "Briana White"){ briana['issues'] += 1; } } } totalCommits = ojas['commits'] + travis['commits'] + edwin['commits'] + ryan['commits'] + briana['commits'] totalIssues = ojas['issues'] + travis['issues'] + edwin['issues'] + ryan['issues'] + briana['issues'] console.log(briana) return (

About Us

We believe that everyone needs to know where their energy is coming from and who is making those decisions. Today, more than ever, we need to make the right choices and how to get our energy and what the impact of energy-related legislation is. This site contains information on states, members of Congress, and legislation related to energy so EVERYONE can make educated decisions.

Our goal in integrating the data is to see if there is a connection between different aspects of a state such as the primary partisanship, population, GDP, and energy consumption and the representatives they elect. In turn, we want to explore if there are characteristics of representatives that might determine how they vote on different energy bills and legislation.

Briana White Senior at UTCS. Enjoys painting, playing video games, and watching movies Frontend Commits: {briana['commits']} Issues: {briana['issues']} Unit tests: 0 Edwin Silerio Can probably find him playing Monster Hunter in his free time. Frontend Commits: {edwin['commits']} Issues: {edwin['issues']} Unit tests: 0 Ojas Patel Likes eating expensive pasta and watching the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Backend Commits: {ojas['commits']} Issues: {ojas['issues']} Unit tests: 0 Ryan Morris CS/English double major. Likes punk music and creative writing. Backend Commits: {ryan['commits']} Issues: {ryan['issues']} Unit tests: 0 Travis Langston Junior CS Major. Loves Scuba Diving and going to metal concerts. Backend Commits: {travis['commits']} Issues: {travis['issues']} Unit tests: 0 Total Stats Commits: {totalCommits} Issues: {totalIssues} Unit tests: 0

Project Links

GitLab Repo Used to collect information in a JSON format about energy consumption and production Postman Documentation API Used to collect information in a JSON format about members of Congress

Data

ETA Used to collect information in a JSON format about energy consumption and production ProPublica Used to collect information in a JSON format about members of Congress Data USA Used to collect information in a JSON format about different states in the United States of America

We scraped each data source using Postman, which generated Python code for us, leveraging the Python requests library.

Tools

React Frontend framework used to build our website Reactstrap Tool with React4 Bootstrap components, making the website beautiful and clean Slack Allowed for easy communication within the team Postman Pulled data from different APIs and created and documented our API GitLab Version control software Flask Python framework to route API calls Namecheap Free domain name provider Amazon Web Services (AWS) Used to host and support the website
); } } export default About;
